content.content:
1â†’if [ "$ZSHRC_PROFILE" != "" ]; then
     2â†’  zmodload zsh/zprof && zprof > /dev/null
     3â†’fi
     4â†’
     5â†’function zsh-profiler() {
     6â†’  ZSHRC_PROFILE=1 zsh -i -c zprof
     7â†’}
     8â†’
     9â†’setopt IGNOREEOF
    10â†’
    11â†’autoload -Uz colors
    12â†’colors
    13â†’
    14â†’autoload -Uz compinit
    15â†’compinit
    16â†’
    17â†’bindkey -e
    18â†’
    19â†’bindkey "^[[3~" delete-char
    20â†’bindkey "^?" backward-delete-char
    21â†’bindkey ";5D" backward-word
    22â†’bindkey ";5C" forward-word
    23â†’
    24â†’autoload -Uz select-word-style
    25â†’select-word-style default
    26â†’zstyle ':zle:*' word-chars ' /=;@:{}[]()<>,|.'
    27â†’zstyle ':zle:*' word-style unspecified
    28â†’
    29â†’setopt share_history
    30â†’setopt histignorealldups
    31â†’setopt hist_ignore_space
    32â†’
    33â†’HISTFILE=$ZDOTDIR/.zsh_history
    34â†’HISTSIZE=2000
    35â†’SAVEHIST=2000
    36â†’
    37â†’# Load common settings
    38â†’if [ -z "$SHELL_COMMON" ]; then
    39â†’  SHELL_COMMON="$HOME/.shell_common"
    40â†’fi
    41â†’[ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/interactive.sh" ] && source "$SHELL_COMMON/interactive.sh"
    42â†’
    43â†’if [ "$HAS_STARSHIP" = "1" ]; then
    44â†’  eval "$(starship init zsh)"
    45â†’fi
    46â†’
    47â†’if type fzf &> /dev/null; then
    48â†’  function fzf-history-selection() {
    49â†’    local selected=""
    50â†’
    51â†’    if [[ -n "$LBUFFER" ]]; then
    52â†’      selected=`history 0 | fzf --query $LBUFFER | awk '{ $1=""; sub(/^[ \t]+/, ""); print }'`
    53â†’    else
    54â†’      selected=`history 0 | fzf | awk '{ $1=""; sub(/^[ \t]+/, ""); print }'`
    55â†’    fi
    56â†’
    57â†’    BUFFER=`[ ${#selected} -gt 0 ] && echo $selected || echo $BUFFER`
    58â†’    CURSOR=$#BUFFER
    59â†’    zle reset-prompt
    60â†’  }
    61â†’
    62â†’  zle -N fzf-history-selection
    63â†’  bindkey '^R' fzf-history-selection
    64â†’fi
    65â†’
    66â†’# zsh-specific FZF tab completion
    67â†’if type fzf &> /dev/null && [ -f ~/.zsh/functions/fzf-tab-completion.zsh ]; then
    68â†’  source ~/.zsh/functions/fzf-tab-completion.zsh
    69â†’  bindkey '^I' fzf_completion
    70â†’fi
    71â†’
    72â†’[ -f "$ZDOTDIR/ni.zsh" ] && source $ZDOTDIR/ni.zsh
    73â†’
    74â†’echo -ne "\033]0;$(basename $PWD)\007"
    75â†’function chpwd() {
    76â†’  echo -ne "\033]0;$(basename $PWD)\007"
    77â†’}
    78â†’
    79â†’# Aikido Safe Chain: wrap package managers with malware scanning
    80â†’[ -f "$HOME/.safe-chain/scripts/init-posix.sh" ] && source "$HOME/.safe-chain/scripts/init-posix.sh"
    81â†’
    82â†’if [ -e $HOME/.zshrc.local ]; then
    83â†’    source $HOME/.zshrc.local
    84â†’fi
    85â†’
    86â†’if [[ "$TERM_PROGRAM" == "vscode" ]]; then
    87â†’  if [[ "$TERM_PROGRAM_VERSION" == *"-insider" ]]; then
    88â†’    . "$(code-insiders --locate-shell-integration-path zsh)"
    89â†’  else
    90â†’    . "$(code --locate-shell-integration-path zsh)"
    91â†’  fi
    92â†’fi
    93â†’
    94â†’:
    95â†’

1â†’#!/bin/sh
     2â†’# Common shell initialization script for both zsh and bash interactive sessions
     3â†’
     4â†’# Load common aliases
     5â†’# shellcheck disable=SC2154
     6â†’[ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/aliases.sh" ] && . "$SHELL_COMMON/aliases.sh"
     7â†’
     8â†’# FZF integration based on shell type
     9â†’if type fzf >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    10â†’  if [ "$CURRENT_SHELL" = "zsh" ]; then
    11â†’    # zsh-specific FZF integration (uses process substitution, zsh-only)
    12â†’    # shellcheck disable=SC3001
    13â†’    . <(fzf --zsh)
    14â†’  else
    15â†’    # bash-specific FZF integration
    16â†’    if [ -f ~/.fzf.bash ]; then
    17â†’      . ~/.fzf.bash
    18â†’    elif [ -f /usr/share/doc/fzf/examples/key-bindings.bash ]; then
    19â†’      . /usr/share/doc/fzf/examples/key-bindings.bash
    20â†’    fi
    21â†’  fi
    22â†’fi
    23â†’
    24â†’# Update checkers (tools and dotfiles)
    25â†’[ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/updates/chezmoi.sh" ] && . "$SHELL_COMMON/updates/chezmoi.sh"
    26â†’[ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/updates/mise.sh" ] && . "$SHELL_COMMON/updates/mise.sh"
    27â†’[ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/updates/dotfiles.sh" ] && . "$SHELL_COMMON/updates/dotfiles.sh"
    28â†’

1â†’# Common shell initialization script for both zsh and bash
     2â†’
     3â†’# Detect current shell
     4â†’# shellcheck disable=SC2206
     5â†’if [ -n "$ZSH_VERSION" ]; then
     6â†’  CURRENT_SHELL="zsh"
     7â†’elif [ -n "$BASH_VERSION" ]; then
     8â†’  CURRENT_SHELL="bash"
     9â†’else
    10â†’  CURRENT_SHELL="sh"  # Fallback
    11â†’fi
    12â†’
    13â†’# Set common directory path
    14â†’if [ -z "$SHELL_COMMON" ]; then
    15â†’  # Default path for deployed files
    16â†’  SHELL_COMMON="$HOME/.shell_common"
    17â†’fi
    18â†’
    19â†’# Load common environment variables
    20â†’[ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/env.sh" ] && . "$SHELL_COMMON/env.sh"
    21â†’
    22â†’
    23â†’# Load common path settings
    24â†’if [ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/path.sh" ]; then
    25â†’  . "$SHELL_COMMON/path.sh"
    26â†’
    27â†’  # Apply paths based on shell type
    28â†’  # Note: COMMON_PATHS array is bash/zsh specific, but this code only runs in those shells
    29â†’  # shellcheck disable=SC3054
    30â†’  if [ "$CURRENT_SHELL" = "zsh" ]; then
    31â†’    # zsh-specific path handling
    32â†’    # shellcheck disable=SC2154
    33â†’    for p in "${COMMON_PATHS[@]}"; do
    34â†’      # shellcheck disable=SC2128,SC2034,SC3030
    35â†’      path=($p $path)
    36â†’    done
    37â†’  else
    38â†’    # bash-specific path handling
    39â†’    # shellcheck disable=SC2154
    40â†’    for p in "${COMMON_PATHS[@]}"; do
    41â†’      add_to_path "$p"
    42â†’    done
    43â†’    export PATH
    44â†’  fi
    45â†’fi
    46â†’
    47â†’# Load common aliases
    48â†’[ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/aliases.sh" ] && . "$SHELL_COMMON/aliases.sh"
    49â†’
    50â†’# Load common functions
    51â†’[ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/functions.sh" ] && . "$SHELL_COMMON/functions.sh"
    52â†’
    53â†’# Load OS-specific common settings
    54â†’case "$(uname -s)" in
    55â†’  Darwin*)
    56â†’    # macOS
    57â†’    [ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/darwin.sh" ] && . "$SHELL_COMMON/darwin.sh"
    58â†’    ;;
    59â†’  Linux*)
    60â†’    # Linux
    61â†’    [ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/linux.sh" ] && . "$SHELL_COMMON/linux.sh"
    62â†’    # WSL detection
    63â†’    if grep -q microsoft /proc/version 2>/dev/null; then
    64â†’      if [ -f "$HOME/.local/bin/wsl2-ssh-agent" ]; then
    65â†’        eval "$($HOME/.local/bin/wsl2-ssh-agent -powershell-path pwsh.exe)"
    66â†’      fi
    67â†’      export BROWSER=wslview
    68â†’    fi
    69â†’    ;;
    70â†’  MINGW*|MSYS*|CYGWIN*)
    71â†’    # Windows
    72â†’    [ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/windows.sh" ] && . "$SHELL_COMMON/windows.sh"
    73â†’    ;;
    74â†’esac
    75â†’
    76â†’# Load common tool integrations
    77â†’[ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/tools.sh" ] && . "$SHELL_COMMON/tools.sh"
    78â†’
    79â†’# Shell-specific tool activations
    80â†’# shellcheck disable=SC2154
    81â†’if [ "$HAS_MISE" = "1" ] && [ -f "$HOME/.local/bin/mise" ]; then
    82â†’  if [ "$CURRENT_SHELL" = "zsh" ]; then
    83â†’    eval "$($HOME/.local/bin/mise activate zsh)"
    84â†’  else
    85â†’    eval "$($HOME/.local/bin/mise activate bash)"
    86â†’  fi
    87â†’fi
    88â†’
    89â†’# Load Rust/Cargo environment
    90â†’if [ -f "$HOME/.cargo/env" ]; then
    91â†’  . "$HOME/.cargo/env"
    92â†’fi
    93â†’
    94â†’# shellcheck disable=SC2154
    95â†’if [ "$HAS_OPAM" = "1" ] && type opam >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    96â†’  eval "$(opam env)"
    97â†’fi
    98â†’
    99â†’

content.content:
1â†’# Common environment variables for all shells
     2â†’
     3â†’# XDG Base Directory specification
     4â†’export XDG_CONFIG_HOME="${XDG_CONFIG_HOME:-$HOME/.config}"
     5â†’
     6â†’# Default editor
     7â†’if type code >/dev/null 2>&1; then
     8â†’  EDITOR="code --wait"
     9â†’elif type emacs >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    10â†’  EDITOR=emacs
    11â†’fi
    12â†’export EDITOR
    13â†’
    14â†’# FZF configuration
    15â†’export FZF_DEFAULT_OPTS="--height=50% --layout=reverse --info=inline --border --padding=1"
    16â†’
    17â†’# Go configuration
    18â†’export GOPATH="${GOPATH:-$HOME/go}"
    19â†’
    20â†’# pnpm global package directory
    21â†’export PNPM_HOME="$HOME/.local/share/pnpm"
    22â†’
    23â†’# Prevent installation of mise-managed tools via Homebrew
    24â†’# These tools are managed by mise and should not be installed via Homebrew
    25â†’# The list is automatically generated from `mise ls` during chezmoi apply
    26â†’{{- $miseTools := output "sh" "-c" "mise ls 2>/dev/null | awk '{print $1}' | sed 's/:.*//g' | sort -u | tr '\n' ' ' | sed 's/ $//' || echo ''" | trim }}
    27â†’{{- if $miseTools }}
    28â†’export HOMEBREW_FORBIDDEN_FORMULAE="{{ $miseTools }}"
    29â†’{{- end }}
    30â†’
    31â†’# Claude Code configuration
    32â†’# Computer name for notifications/TTS (auto-detected from hostname)
    33â†’export CLAUDE_COMPUTER_NAME="{{ .chezmoi.hostname }}"
    34â†’
    35â†’# Machine-specific settings (not tracked in git)
    36â†’# Create ~/local.env.sh to override settings above, e.g.:
    37â†’#   export CLAUDE_COMPUTER_NAME="My Custom Name"
    38â†’if [ -f ~/local.env.sh ]; then
    39â†’  . ~/local.env.sh
    40â†’fi
    41â†’

content.content:
1â†’#!/bin/sh
     2â†’# Common tool integrations for all shells
     3â†’
     4â†’# mise integration
     5â†’if [ -f "$HOME/.local/bin/mise" ]; then
     6â†’  # The actual activation will be done in shell-specific files
     7â†’  export HAS_MISE=1
     8â†’fi
     9â†’
    10â†’# opam configuration
    11â†’if type opam >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    12â†’  # The actual evaluation will be done in shell-specific files
    13â†’  export HAS_OPAM=1
    14â†’fi
    15â†’
    16â†’# Starship prompt integration
    17â†’if type starship >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    18â†’  export HAS_STARSHIP=1
    19â†’fi
    20â†’
    21â†’# gcloud configuration with mise python
    22â†’if type mise >/dev/null 2>&1 && mise list | grep python >/dev/null && type gcloud >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    23â†’  # shellcheck disable=SC2155
    24â†’  export CLOUDSDK_PYTHON="$(mise which python)"
    25â†’fi
    26â†’
    27â†’

content.content:
1â†’#!/bin/sh
     2â†’# Common PATH configuration for all shells
     3â†’
     4â†’# Define paths to add (as an array for easier maintenance)
     5â†’# shellcheck disable=SC2154 # PNPM_HOME is exported in env.sh
     6â†’_common_paths=(
     7â†’  "$HOME/.local/bin"
     8â†’  "$HOME/.local/.bin"
     9â†’  "$HOME/.deno/bin"
    10â†’  "$HOME/.moon/bin"
    11â†’  "$HOME/google-cloud-sdk/bin"
    12â†’  "$HOME/workspace/depot_tools"
    13â†’  "${GOPATH:-$HOME/go}/bin"
    14â†’  "$PNPM_HOME"
    15â†’)
    16â†’
    17â†’# Function to add paths to PATH without duplication
    18â†’# This function will be called by shell-specific scripts
    19â†’add_to_path() {
    20â†’  local new_path="$1"
    21â†’  case ":$PATH:" in
    22â†’    *":$new_path:"*) :;; # Already in PATH
    23â†’    *) PATH="$new_path:$PATH";;
    24â†’  esac
    25â†’}
    26â†’
    27â†’# Export the paths array for shell-specific handling
    28â†’COMMON_PATHS=("${_common_paths[@]}")
    29â†’

content.content:
1â†’# Shell Common Configuration
     2â†’
     3â†’This directory contains common shell configuration files that are shared between zsh and bash, along with a comprehensive testing suite.
     4â†’
     5â†’## Structure
     6â†’
     7â†’### Core Configuration Files
     8â†’- `init.sh` - Common entry point for both shells
     9â†’- `path.sh` - Common PATH configuration
    10â†’- `aliases.sh` - Common aliases
    11â†’- `functions.sh` - Common shell functions
    12â†’- `env.sh` - Common environment variables
    13â†’- `tools.sh` - Common tool integrations (mise, opam, etc.)
    14â†’- `darwin.sh` - macOS-specific common settings
    15â†’- `linux.sh` - Linux-specific common settings
    16â†’- `windows.sh` - Windows-specific common settings
    17â†’
    18â†’### Testing Suite
    19â†’- `test_suite.sh` - Comprehensive testing and health check system
    20â†’- `executable_doctor` - Legacy wrapper for backward compatibility
    21â†’- `core/` - Core testing infrastructure
    22â†’  - `test_engine.sh` - Main test engine with 8 categories
    23â†’  - `reporter.sh` - Test reporting and output formatting
    24â†’  - `validator.sh` - Validation utilities
    25â†’- `adapters/` - Environment-specific adapter pattern
    26â†’
    27â†’## Usage
    28â†’
    29â†’### Loading Configuration
    30â†’The common configuration is loaded from the shell-specific configuration files:
    31â†’
    32â†’- For zsh: `~/.zsh/dot_zshrc.tmpl`
    33â†’- For bash: `~/.bash/dot_bashrc`
    34â†’
    35â†’### Health Checks
    36â†’Run comprehensive health checks on your dotfiles setup:
    37â†’
    38â†’```bash
    39â†’# Full health check
    40â†’./test_suite.sh
    41â†’
    42â†’# Check specific categories
    43â†’./test_suite.sh --categories=core,tools
    44â†’
    45â†’# Verbose output
    46â†’./test_suite.sh -v
    47â†’
    48â†’# Quiet mode
    49â†’./test_suite.sh -q
    50â†’```
    51â†’
    52â†’### Test Categories
    53â†’- **core** - Essential commands (sh, bash, git, curl, chezmoi)
    54â†’- **tools** - Development tools (rg, fzf, bat, jq, mise)
    55â†’- **languages** - Programming language runtimes
    56â†’- **development** - Development environment (starship, gh, vim)
    57â†’- **security** - Security tools (age, 1password-cli)
    58â†’- **config** - Configuration files and directories
    59â†’- **shell** - Shell compatibility and features
    60â†’- **integration** - Shell functions and aliases integration
    61â†’
    62â†’## Design Principles
    63â†’
    64â†’1. **Shell Detection**: The `init.sh` file detects the current shell and applies appropriate shell-specific handling.
    65â†’2. **Minimal Duplication**: Common settings are defined once and used by both shells.
    66â†’3. **Shell-Specific Optimizations**: Each shell can still use its own optimized implementations for certain features.
    67â†’4. **Maintainability**: Changes to common settings only need to be made in one place.
    68â†’5. **Testing-First**: Comprehensive testing ensures reliability across environments.
    69â†’
    70â†’## Adding New Settings
    71â†’
    72â†’To add new common settings:
    73â†’
    74â†’1. Identify if the setting is truly common or shell-specific
    75â†’2. For common settings, add them to the appropriate common file
    76â†’3. For shell-specific settings, keep them in the shell-specific configuration files
    77â†’4. Add appropriate tests to the test suite for verification
    78â†’
    79â†’## Troubleshooting
    80â†’
    81â†’If you encounter issues with the common configuration:
    82â†’
    83â†’1. Run `./test_suite.sh` to identify problems
    84â†’2. Check that `$HOME/.shell_common/init.sh` is being sourced correctly
    85â†’3. Verify that the shell detection is working properly
    86â†’4. Check for syntax errors in the common configuration files
    87â†’5. Ensure that shell-specific features are properly handled
    88â†’
    89â†’Use the testing suite to validate your configuration and get actionable recommendations for fixes.
    90â†’

content.content:
1â†’# Zsh Configuration
     2â†’
     3â†’This directory contains the Zsh configuration managed by chezmoi.
     4â†’
     5â†’## Files
     6â†’
     7â†’- `dot_zshenv` - Environment variables (loaded first by Zsh)
     8â†’- `dot_zshrc` - Interactive shell configuration
     9â†’
    10â†’## Key Features
    11â†’
    12â†’- **Profiling support**: `zsh-profiler` function for performance debugging
    13â†’- **History**: 2000 entries, shared across sessions
    14â†’- **Key bindings**: Emacs style
    15â†’- **Platform support**: Darwin (macOS), Linux, WSL
    16â†’- **Tool integrations**: fzf, mise, direnv, etc.
    17â†’- **Local overrides**: `~/.zshrc.local` for machine-specific settings
    18â†’
    19â†’## Custom Prompt
    20â†’
    21â†’The configuration includes a feature-rich prompt with:
    22â†’- Git status integration (branch, dirty state)
    23â†’- Node.js project info (package version, runtime version)
    24â†’- Error status indication
    25â†’- SSH connection awareness
    26â†’- Command timestamp
    27â†’
    28â†’## Migration Notes
    29â†’
    30â†’When porting to another environment:
    31â†’1. Review tool integrations (fzf, mise) based on availability
    32â†’2. Adapt platform-specific sections as needed
    33â†’3. Maintain `~/.zshrc.local` support for local overrides
    34â†’

content.content:
1â†’#!/bin/sh
     2â†’# Common functions for all shells
     3â†’
     4â†’# shellcheck disable=SC2154,SC2046
     5â†’# Extract various archive formats
     6â†’extract() {
     7â†’  if [ -f "$1" ]; then
     8â†’    case "$1" in
     9â†’      *.tar.bz2)   tar xjf "$1"     ;;
    10â†’      *.tar.gz)    tar xzf "$1"     ;;
    11â†’      *.bz2)       bunzip2 "$1"     ;;
    12â†’      *.rar)       unrar e "$1"     ;;
    13â†’      *.gz)        gunzip "$1"      ;;
    14â†’      *.tar)       tar xf "$1"      ;;
    15â†’      *.tbz2)      tar xjf "$1"     ;;
    16â†’      *.tgz)       tar xzf "$1"     ;;
    17â†’      *.zip)       unzip "$1"       ;;
    18â†’      *.Z)         uncompress "$1"  ;;
    19â†’      *.7z)        7z x "$1"        ;;
    20â†’      *)           echo "'$1' cannot be extracted via extract()" ;;
    21â†’    esac
    22â†’  else
    23â†’    echo "'$1' is not a valid file"
    24â†’  fi
    25â†’}
    26â†’
    27â†’# 1Password helper functions
    28â†’_ope_auth_check() {
    29â†’	op whoami >/dev/null 2>&1 || eval $(op signin)
    30â†’}
    31â†’
    32â†’_ope_update_paths() {
    33â†’	path="$1"
    34â†’	case ":${OP_COMMAND_PATHS}:" in
    35â†’		*":${path}:"*) ;;  # Already in path
    36â†’		*) export OP_COMMAND_PATHS="${OP_COMMAND_PATHS:+$OP_COMMAND_PATHS:}$path" ;;
    37â†’	esac
    38â†’}
    39â†’
    40â†’# Get env files based on scope (outputs file paths, one per line)
    41â†’_ope_get_env_files() {
    42â†’	scope="$1"
    43â†’	if [ "$scope" = "global" ]; then
    44â†’		[ -f "$HOME/.env.1password" ] && echo "$HOME/.env.1password"
    45â†’		[ -f "$HOME/.env.1password.local" ] && echo "$HOME/.env.1password.local"
    46â†’	else
    47â†’		[ -f "$PWD/.env" ] && echo "$PWD/.env"
    48â†’		[ -f "$PWD/.env.local" ] && echo "$PWD/.env.local"
    49â†’	fi
    50â†’}
    51â†’
    52â†’# Unified 1Password environment helper
    53â†’# Usage: ope [-g|--global] [-i|--interactive] [-l|--load] [command...]
    54â†’#   -g, --global       Use global env files (~/.env.1password*)
    55â†’#   -i, --interactive  Interactive mode (PTY for commands like claude)
    56â†’#   -l, --load         Load/inject secrets into current shell
    57â†’#   -h, --help         Show help
    58â†’ope() {
    59â†’	global=false
    60â†’	interactive=false
    61â†’	load=false
    62â†’
    63â†’	# Parse flags
    64â†’	while [ $# -gt 0 ]; do
    65â†’		case "$1" in
    66â†’			-g|--global)  global=true; shift ;;
    67â†’			-i|--interactive)  interactive=true; shift ;;
    68â†’			-l|--load)  load=true; shift ;;
    69â†’			-gi|-ig) global=true; interactive=true; shift ;;
    70â†’			-gl|-lg) global=true; load=true; shift ;;
    71â†’			-il|-li) interactive=true; load=true; shift ;;  # Invalid but handle gracefully
    72â†’			-h|--help)
    73â†’				echo "Usage: ope [-g|--global] [-i|--interactive] [-l|--load] [command...]"
    74â†’				echo ""
    75â†’				echo "Flags:"
    76â†’				echo "  -g, --global       Use global env files (~/.env.1password, ~/.env.1password.local)"
    77â†’				echo "  -i, --interactive  Interactive mode (uses PTY for commands like claude)"
    78â†’				echo "  -l, --load         Load/inject secrets into current shell environment"
    79â†’				echo "  -h, --help         Show this help"
    80â†’				echo ""
    81â†’				echo "Examples:"
    82â†’				echo "  ope npm start          # Run with local .env"
    83â†’				echo "  ope -g npm start       # Run with global env"
    84â†’				echo "  ope -i claude          # Interactive command with local env"
    85â†’				echo "  ope -gi claude         # Interactive command with global env"
    86â†’				echo "  ope -l                 # Load local env into shell"
    87â†’				echo "  ope -gl                # Load global env into shell"
    88â†’				echo ""
    89â†’				echo "Aliases: opr, opri, opl, oprg, oprgi, oplg (for backward compatibility)"
    90â†’				return 0
    91â†’				;;
    92â†’			-*) echo "âŒ Unknown flag: $1"; ope -h; return 1 ;;
    93â†’			*)  break ;;
    94â†’		esac
    95â†’	done
    96â†’
    97â†’	# Require command when not in load mode
    98â†’	if ! $load && [ $# -eq 0 ]; then
    99â†’		echo "âŒ No command specified. Use 'ope -l' to load secrets, or provide a command."
   100â†’		ope -h
   101â†’		return 1
   102â†’	fi
   103â†’
   104â†’	_ope_auth_check
   105â†’
   106â†’	# Determine scope
   107â†’	scope="local"
   108â†’	$global && scope="global"
   109â†’
   110â†’	# Get env files (newline-separated string instead of array)
   111â†’	env_files=$(_ope_get_env_files "$scope")
   112â†’
   113â†’	# Check if env files exist
   114â†’	if [ -z "$env_files" ]; then
   115â†’		if $global; then
   116â†’			echo "âŒ Neither ~/.env.1password nor ~/.env.1password.local found"
   117â†’		else
   118â†’			echo "âŒ Neither .env nor .env.local found in current directory ($PWD)"
   119â†’			echo "   Use 'ope -g' to use global env files"
   120â†’		fi
   121â†’		return 1
   122â†’	fi
   123â†’
   124â†’	# Execute based on mode
   125â†’	if $load; then
   126â†’		scope_label="local"
   127â†’		update_path="$PWD"
   128â†’		if $global; then
   129â†’			scope_label="global"
   130â†’			update_path="$HOME"
   131â†’		fi
   132â†’
   133â†’		echo "â³ Setting $scope_label secrets in environment..."
   134â†’		echo "$env_files" | while IFS= read -r env_file; do
   135â†’			[ -n "$env_file" ] || continue
   136â†’			echo "ğŸ“ Loading $(basename "$env_file")"
   137â†’			# shellcheck disable=SC1090
   138â†’			. /dev/stdin <<EOF
   139â†’$(cat "$env_file" | op inject)
   140â†’EOF
   141â†’		done
   142â†’		_ope_update_paths "$update_path"
   143â†’		echo "â˜‘ï¸ Done!"
   144â†’	else
   145â†’		# Parse env files into variables using here-doc to avoid subshell
   146â†’		# Note: Scopes are exclusive (global OR local), so max 2 files per invocation
   147â†’		env_file1=""
   148â†’		env_file2=""
   149â†’		while IFS= read -r _env_file || [ -n "$_env_file" ]; do
   150â†’			[ -n "$_env_file" ] || continue
   151â†’			if [ -z "$env_file1" ]; then
   152â†’				env_file1="$_env_file"
   153â†’			else
   154â†’				env_file2="$_env_file"
   155â†’			fi
   156â†’		done <<EOF
   157â†’$env_files
   158â†’EOF
   159â†’
   160â†’		if $interactive; then
   161â†’			# Launch shell in interactive mode (-i) to ensure rc files are loaded
   162â†’			# This preserves PATH and tool initialization (mise/asdf) naturally
   163â†’			current_shell="${SHELL:-/bin/sh}"
   164â†’			# script command syntax differs between Linux and macOS
   165â†’			if [ "$(uname)" = "Darwin" ]; then
   166â†’				# macOS: script [-q] file command
   167â†’				if [ -n "$env_file2" ]; then
   168â†’					op run --env-file="$env_file1" --env-file="$env_file2" -- script -q /dev/null "$current_shell" -i -c "$*"
   169â†’				else
   170â†’					op run --env-file="$env_file1" -- script -q /dev/null "$current_shell" -i -c "$*"
   171â†’				fi
   172â†’			else
   173â†’				# Linux: script [-q] -c command file
   174â†’				if [ -n "$env_file2" ]; then
   175â†’					op run --env-file="$env_file1" --env-file="$env_file2" -- script -q /dev/null -c "$current_shell -i -c \"$*\""
   176â†’				else
   177â†’					op run --env-file="$env_file1" -- script -q /dev/null -c "$current_shell -i -c \"$*\""
   178â†’				fi
   179â†’			fi
   180â†’		else
   181â†’			if [ -n "$env_file2" ]; then
   182â†’				op run --env-file="$env_file1" --env-file="$env_file2" -- "$@"
   183â†’			else
   184â†’				op run --env-file="$env_file1" -- "$@"
   185â†’			fi
   186â†’		fi
   187â†’	fi
   188â†’}
   189â†’
   190â†’export OP_COMMAND_PATHS=$OP_COMMAND_PATHS # Preserve existing values
   191â†’
   192â†’# Backward-compatible aliases for ope
   193â†’opr()   { ope "$@"; }
   194â†’opri()  { ope -i "$@"; }
   195â†’opl()   { ope -l; }
   196â†’oprg()  { ope -g "$@"; }
   197â†’oprgi() { ope -gi "$@"; }
   198â†’oplg()  { ope -gl; }
   199â†’
   200â†’# Enhanced dotfiles health check function - now using unified test suite
   201â†’dotfiles_doctor() {
   202â†’  local script_path="$SHELL_COMMON/test_suite.sh"
   203â†’  
   204â†’  # Check if new unified test suite exists
   205â†’  if [ -f "$script_path" ]; then
   206â†’    # Show upgrade notice for interactive sessions (not in quiet mode)
   207â†’    local show_notice=1
   208â†’    for arg in "$@"; do
   209â†’      case "$arg" in
   210â†’        -q|--quiet) show_notice=0 ;;
   211â†’      esac
   212â†’    done
   213â†’    
   214â†’    if [ $show_notice -eq 1 ] && [ -t 1 ]; then
   215â†’      echo "ğŸš€ dotfiles_doctor() upgraded with enhanced features:" >&2
   216â†’      echo "   â€¢ Weighted health scoring" >&2
   217â†’      echo "   â€¢ Actionable recommendations" >&2
   218â†’      echo "   â€¢ Chezmoi apply readiness status" >&2
   219â†’      echo "" >&2
   220â†’    fi
   221â†’    
   222â†’    # Execute new test suite with all arguments
   223â†’    "$SHELL" "$script_path" "$@"
   224â†’  elif [ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/dotfiles_doctor.sh" ]; then
   225â†’    # Fallback to legacy if new suite not found
   226â†’    echo "âš ï¸  Using legacy dotfiles_doctor.sh (consider upgrading)" >&2
   227â†’    "$SHELL" "$SHELL_COMMON/dotfiles_doctor.sh" "$@"
   228â†’  else
   229â†’    echo "âŒ Neither test_suite.sh nor dotfiles_doctor.sh found at $SHELL_COMMON/" >&2
   230â†’    echo "   Please ensure dotfiles are properly installed." >&2
   231â†’    return 1
   232â†’  fi
   233â†’}
   234â†’

content.content:
1â†’autoload -Uz add-zsh-hook
     2â†’
     3â†’setopt prompt_subst
     4â†’
     5â†’typeset -A emoji
     6â†’emoji[ok]=$'\U2705'
     7â†’emoji[error]=$'\U274C'
     8â†’emoji[git]=$'\U1F500'
     9â†’emoji[git_staged]=$'\U1F4DD'
    10â†’emoji[git_changed]=$'\U1F4AC'
    11â†’emoji[git_untracked]=$'\U2757'
    12â†’emoji[git_clean]=$'\U2728'
    13â†’emoji[node_package]=$'\U1F4E6'
    14â†’emoji[right_arrow]=$'\U2794'
    15â†’
    16â†’readonly local br=$'\n'
    17â†’readonly local rawbr="
    18â†’"
    19â†’
    20â†’local vcs_git_indicator
    21â†’function __vcs_git_indicator () {
    22â†’  typeset -A git_info
    23â†’  typeset -a git_indicator
    24â†’  local git_status
    25â†’  git_status=("${(f)$(git status --porcelain --branch 2> /dev/null)}")
    26â†’  (( $? == 0 )) && {
    27â†’    git_info[branch]="${${git_status[1]}#\#\# }"
    28â†’    shift git_status
    29â†’    git_info[all]=$#git_status
    30â†’    git_info[tracked]=${#git_status:#\?\?*} # untrackã˜ã‚ƒãªã„ã‚‚ã®
    31â†’    git_info[untracked]=$(( ${git_info[all]} - ${git_info[tracked]}))
    32â†’    git_info[staged]=$(( ${#git_status:# ?*} - ${git_info[untracked]} )) # 1æ–‡å­—ç›®ãŒç©ºç™½ã˜ã‚ƒãªãã¦untrackã§ã¯ãªã„ã‚‚ã®ï¼ˆuntrackãŒ/^??/ã«ãƒãƒƒãƒã™ã‚‹å‰æ
    33â†’    git_info[changed]=${#git_status:#? *} # 2æ–‡å­—ç›®ãŒç©ºç™½ã˜ã‚ƒãªã„ã‚‚ã®
    34â†’    git_info[clean]=$(( ${git_info[all]} == 0 ))
    35â†’
    36â†’    git_indicator+=("${emoji[git]} %{%F{blue}%B%}${git_info[branch]}%{%b%f%}")
    37â†’    (( ${git_info[clean]}     )) && git_indicator+=("${emoji[git_clean]}")
    38â†’    (( ${git_info[staged]}    )) && git_indicator+=("${emoji[git_staged]} %{%F{green}%}${git_info[staged]} staged%{%f%}")
    39â†’    (( ${git_info[changed]}   )) && git_indicator+=("${emoji[git_changed]} %{%F{yellow}%}${git_info[changed]} unstaged%{%f%}")
    40â†’    (( ${git_info[untracked]} )) && git_indicator+=("${emoji[git_untracked]} %{%F{red}%}${git_info[untracked]} untracked%{%f%}")
    41â†’  }
    42â†’
    43â†’  vcs_git_indicator="$git_indicator"
    44â†’  if [ -n "$git_indicator" ]; then
    45â†’    vcs_git_indicator+=$rawbr
    46â†’  fi
    47â†’}
    48â†’
    49â†’add-zsh-hook precmd __vcs_git_indicator
    50â†’
    51â†’local env_js_indicator env_js_indicator_cached env_js_lastpwd
    52â†’function __env_js_indicator() {
    53â†’  typeset -a js_indicator js_package_version
    54â†’  local package_version package_name
    55â†’  package_version=$(jq -r ".version" ./package.json 2> /dev/null)
    56â†’  package_name=$(jq -r ".name" ./package.json 2> /dev/null)
    57â†’  (( ${#package_version} != 0 )) && {
    58â†’    js_package_version+=("${emoji[node_package]} %F{214}$package_name@v$package_version%f")
    59â†’
    60â†’    if [ "$env_js_lastpwd" != "$PWD" ]; then
    61â†’      local node_version
    62â†’
    63â†’      if  [ -z "$node_version" ]; then
    64â†’        node_version=$(node -v 2> /dev/null)
    65â†’      fi
    66â†’
    67â†’      if [ -n "$node_version" ]; then
    68â†’        js_indicator+=("via %F{green}nodejs $node_version%f")
    69â†’      fi
    70â†’
    71â†’      local npm_version yarn_version pnpm_version
    72â†’      if [ -z "$npm_version" -a -e package-lock.json ]; then
    73â†’        npm_version=$(npm -v 2> /dev/null)
    74â†’      fi
    75â†’
    76â†’      if [ -n "$npm_version" ]; then
    77â†’        js_indicator+=("with %F{green}npm v$npm_version%f")
    78â†’      fi
    79â†’
    80â†’      if [ -z "$yarn_version" -a -e yarn.lock ]; then
    81â†’        yarn_version=$(yarn -v 2> /dev/null)
    82â†’      fi
    83â†’
    84â†’      if [ -n "$yarn_version" ]; then
    85â†’        js_indicator+=("with %F{green}yarn v$yarn_version%f")
    86â†’      fi
    87â†’
    88â†’      if [ -z "$pnpm_version" -a -e pnpm-lock.yaml ]; then
    89â†’        pnpm_version=$(pnpm -v 2> /dev/null)
    90â†’      fi
    91â†’
    92â†’      if [ -n "$pnpm_version" ]; then
    93â†’        js_indicator+=("with %F{green}pnpm v$pnpm_version%f")
    94â†’      fi
    95â†’
    96â†’      env_js_indicator_cached="$js_indicator"
    97â†’    fi
    98â†’  }
    99â†’
   100â†’  if (( ${#js_package_version} > 0 )); then
   101â†’    env_js_indicator="$js_package_version $env_js_indicator_cached$rawbr"
   102â†’  else
   103â†’    env_js_indicator=""
   104â†’  fi
   105â†’
   106â†’  env_js_lastpwd=$PWD
   107â†’}
   108â†’
   109â†’add-zsh-hook precmd __env_js_indicator
   110â†’
   111â†’function {
   112â†’  local dir='%F{green}%B%~%{%b%f%}'
   113â†’  local rc="%(?,${emoji[ok]} ,${emoji[error]} %F{red}%?%f)"
   114â†’  local br=$'\n'
   115â†’
   116â†’  local user
   117â†’  if [ $UID -eq 0 ]; then
   118â†’      user='%F{red}%B%n%b%f'
   119â†’  else
   120â†’      user='%F{cyan}%B%n%b%f'
   121â†’  fi
   122â†’
   123â†’  local host='%F{blue}%B%m%b%f'
   124â†’  [ "$SSH_CLIENT" ] && local via="${${=SSH_CLIENT}[1]} %{%B%}${emoji[right_arrow]}%{%b%} "
   125â†’  local git='$vcs_git_indicator'
   126â†’  local js='$env_js_indicator'
   127â†’  local mark=$'> '
   128â†’  local datetime=$'%D{%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S %Z(%z)}'
   129â†’
   130â†’  # æœ€åˆã¯è¡¨ç¤ºæ™‚ã®æ™‚åˆ»ãŒå‡ºã‚‹
   131â†’  PROMPT="$dir $user($via$host)$rc %F{blue}$datetime%f $br$js$git$mark"
   132â†’  # ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰å®Ÿè¡Œã™ã‚‹ã¨å®Ÿè¡Œæ™‚ã®æ™‚åˆ»ãŒæ®‹ã‚‹
   133â†’  BASE_PROMPT="$dir $user($via$host)$rc %F{magenta}$datetime%f $br$js$git$mark"
   134â†’}
   135â†’
   136â†’function __rewrite_on_accept() {
   137â†’  if [[ ${#PROMPT} -ne ${#BASE_PROMPT} ]]; then
   138â†’    local saved=$PROMPT
   139â†’    PROMPT=$BASE_PROMPT
   140â†’    zle reset-prompt
   141â†’    PROMPT=$saved
   142â†’  fi
   143â†’  zle accept-line
   144â†’}
   145â†’zle -N __rewrite_on_accept
   146â†’bindkey '^M' __rewrite_on_accept
   147â†’

content.content:
=== Source state check ===

=== .zshrc current content ===
if [ "$ZSHRC_PROFILE" != "" ]; then
  zmodload zsh/zprof && zprof > /dev/null
fi

function zsh-profiler() {
  ZSHRC_PROFILE=1 zsh -i -c zprof
}

setopt IGNOREEOF

autoload -Uz colors
colors

autoload -Uz compinit
compinit

bindkey -e

bindkey "^[[3~" delete-char
bindkey "^?" backward-delete-char
bindkey ";5D" backward-word
bindkey ";5C" forward-word

autoload -Uz select-word-style
select-word-style default
zstyle ':zle:*' word-chars ' /=;@:{}[]()<>,|.'
zstyle ':zle:*' word-style unspecified

setopt share_history
setopt histignorealldups
setopt hist_ignore_space

HISTFILE=$ZDOTDIR/.zsh_history
HISTSIZE=2000
SAVEHIST=2000

# Load common settings
if [ -z "$SHELL_COMMON" ]; then
  SHELL_COMMON="$HOME/.shell_common"
fi
[ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/interactive.sh" ] && source "$SHELL_COMMON/interactive.sh"

if [ "$HAS_STARSHIP" = "1" ]; then
  eval "$(starship init zsh)"
fi

if type fzf &> /dev/null; then
  function fzf-history-selection() {
    local selected=""

    if [[ -n "$LBUFFER" ]]; then
      selected=`history 0 | fzf --query $LBUFFER | awk '{ $1=""; sub(/^[ \t]+/, ""); print }'`
    else
      selected=`history 0 | fzf | awk '{ $1=""; sub(/^[ \t]+/, ""); print }'`
    fi

    BUFFER=`[ ${#selected} -gt 0 ] && echo $selected || echo $BUFFER`
    CURSOR=$#BUFFER
    zle reset-prompt
  }

  zle -N fzf-history-selection
  bindkey '^R' fzf-history-selection
fi

# zsh-specific FZF tab completion
if type fzf &> /dev/null && [ -f ~/.zsh/functions/fzf-tab-completion.zsh ]; then
  source ~/.zsh/functions/fzf-tab-completion.zsh
  bindkey '^I' fzf_completion
fi

[ -f "$ZDOTDIR/ni.zsh" ] && source $ZDOTDIR/ni.zsh

echo -ne "\033]0;$(basename $PWD)\007"
function chpwd() {
  echo -ne "\033]0;$(basename $PWD)\007"
}

# Aikido Safe Chain: wrap package managers with malware scanning
[ -f "$HOME/.safe-chain/scripts/init-posix.sh" ] && source "$HOME/.safe-chain/scripts/init-posix.sh"

if [ -e $HOME/.zshrc.local ]; then
    source $HOME/.zshrc.local
fi

if [[ "$TERM_PROGRAM" == "vscode" ]]; then
  if [[ "$TERM_PROGRAM_VERSION" == *"-insider" ]]; then
    . "$(code-insiders --locate-shell-integration-path zsh)"
  else
    . "$(code --locate-shell-integration-path zsh)"
  fi
fi

input.command:
cat > /tmp/shell_flow.txt << 'EOF'
Shell Initialization Flow
==========================

ZSH STARTUP SEQUENCE:
=====================

1. ~/.zshenv (2è¡Œ)
   â””â”€ Set ZDOTDIR=$HOME/.zsh
   â””â”€ Source ~/.zsh/.zshenv

2. ~/.zsh/.zshenv (9è¡Œ in source state)
   â””â”€ Sources ~/.shell_common/init.sh

3. ~/.shell_common/init.sh (99 lines in source state, deployed 2531 bytes)
   â”œâ”€ Detect current shell (CURRENT_SHELL=zsh)
   â”œâ”€ Set SHELL_COMMON=$HOME/.shell_common
   â”œâ”€ Source ~/.shell_common/env.sh (template-generated)
   â”‚  â”œâ”€ Set XDG_CONFIG_HOME
   â”‚  â”œâ”€ Set EDITOR (code --wait or emacs)
   â”‚  â”œâ”€ Export FZF_DEFAULT_OPTS
   â”‚  â”œâ”€ Set GOPATH, PNPM_HOME
   â”‚  â””â”€ Auto-detect mise tools for HOMEBREW_FORBIDDEN_FORMULAE
   â”œâ”€ Source ~/.shell_common/path.sh
   â”‚  â””â”€ Build and prepend COMMON_PATHS to $PATH
   â”œâ”€ Source ~/.shell_common/aliases.sh (deployed 94 bytes)
   â”œâ”€ Source ~/.shell_common/functions.sh (7335 bytes, contains ope, extract, etc.)
   â”œâ”€ Load OS-specific settings (darwin.sh, linux.sh, windows.sh)
   â”œâ”€ Source ~/.shell_common/tools.sh
   â”‚  â”œâ”€ Detect mise â†’ export HAS_MISE=1
   â”‚  â”œâ”€ Detect opam â†’ export HAS_OPAM=1
   â”‚  â””â”€ [CRITICAL] Detect starship â†’ export HAS_STARSHIP=1
   â”œâ”€ Shell-specific tool activation (mise)
   â”œâ”€ Load Rust/Cargo environment
   â””â”€ Load OPAM environment

4. Interactive shell initialization (~/.zshrc)
   â”œâ”€ Load profiler (optional ZSHRC_PROFILE)
   â”œâ”€ Configure zsh options (ignoreeof, colors, completion, bindings)
   â”œâ”€ Set history (2000 entries, shared)
   â”œâ”€ Source ~/.shell_common/interactive.sh
   â”‚  â”œâ”€ Load aliases
   â”‚  â”œâ”€ Integrate FZF (zsh-specific: . <(fzf --zsh))
   â”‚  â””â”€ Load update checkers (chezmoi, mise, dotfiles)
   â”œâ”€ [STARSHIP ACTIVATION] If HAS_STARSHIP=1
   â”‚  â””â”€ eval "$(starship init zsh)"
   â”œâ”€ FZF history selection (^R binding)
   â”œâ”€ FZF tab completion
   â”œâ”€ Load ni.zsh (node package manager integration)
   â”œâ”€ Set terminal title
   â”œâ”€ Load Aikido Safe Chain
   â””â”€ Source ~/.zshrc.local (optional machine-specific)

STARSHIP INTEGRATION:
====================

Detection Phase (during init.sh):
- ~/.shell_common/tools.sh checks: type starship >/dev/null 2>&1
- Sets: export HAS_STARSHIP=1

Activation Phase (during .zshrc):
- Checks: if [ "$HAS_STARSHIP" = "1" ]
- Command: eval "$(starship init zsh)"
  â””â”€ This initializes starship in the interactive shell

Configuration:
- starship reads from: ~/.config/starship.toml (XDG standard)
- Config path can be overridden via: STARSHIP_CONFIG env var

PROMPT RENDERING:
================

When starship is active, the prompt format from ~/.config/starship.toml controls display:

Line 1: [shell] [directory] [.env indicator] [username] @ [hostname]
       Shows execution status, timestamp, command duration

Line 2: [nodejs info] [git branch] [git status]
       Shows version info for detected Node/npm/yarn/pnpm

Line 3: [prompt character]
       > (green if success, red if error)

PROMPT.ZSH (Legacy/Alternative):
=================================

Located at: ~/.zsh/prompt.zsh
- Custom zsh prompt with Git and Node.js status
- Uses zsh hooks: add-zsh-hook precmd
- NOT sourced in current .zshrc (starship takes precedence)
- Contains custom Git and package version logic
- May be leftover from pre-starship configuration

CONFIGURATION FILES SUMMARY:
===========================

Source State (home/ in repo):
  â”œâ”€ dot_zshenv â†’ ~/.zshenv
  â”œâ”€ dot_zsh/dot_zshenv â†’ ~/.zsh/.zshenv
  â”œâ”€ dot_zsh/dot_zshrc â†’ ~/.zsh/.zshrc
  â”œâ”€ dot_shell_common/ â†’ ~/.shell_common/
  â”‚  â”œâ”€ init.sh (entry point)
  â”‚  â”œâ”€ env.sh.tmpl (template-generated)
  â”‚  â”œâ”€ path.sh
  â”‚  â”œâ”€ aliases.sh
  â”‚  â”œâ”€ functions.sh
  â”‚  â”œâ”€ tools.sh (HAS_STARSHIP detection)
  â”‚  â”œâ”€ interactive.sh
  â”‚  â”œâ”€ darwin.sh, linux.sh, windows.sh
  â”‚  â””â”€ ... (other utilities)
  â””â”€ dot_config/starship.toml â†’ ~/.config/starship.toml

Deployed State ($HOME):
  â”œâ”€ ~/.zshenv (symlinked)
  â”œâ”€ ~/.zsh/.zshenv
  â”œâ”€ ~/.zsh/.zshrc
  â”œâ”€ ~/.shell_common/ (deployed directory)
  â”œâ”€ ~/.config/starship.toml
  â””â”€ ~/.zsh/prompt.zsh (legacy, not actively used)
EOF
cat /tmp/shell_flow.txt

# Get editor completions based on the config schema
"$schema" = 'https://starship.rs/config-schema.json'

# å…¨ä½“çš„ãªãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆè¨­å®š
format = """
$shell\
$directory\
${custom.envfile}\
$username\
[@](yellow)\
$hostname\
$status\
$time\
$cmd_duration\
$line_break\
($nodejs\
$package
)\
($git_branch\
$git_state\
$git_status
)\
$character
"""

# ãƒ—ãƒ­ãƒ³ãƒ—ãƒˆé–“ã«ç©ºè¡Œã‚’æŒ¿å…¥
add_newline = true

[shell]
format = '[$indicator]($style)'
bash_indicator = "bash "
zsh_indicator = ""
disabled = false

# ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒªè¡¨ç¤ºè¨­å®š
[directory]
style = "bold green"
truncation_length = 100
truncate_to_repo = false

# ãƒ¦ãƒ¼ã‚¶ãƒ¼åè¡¨ç¤ºè¨­å®š
[username]
format = "[$user]($style)"
style_root = "bold red"
style_user = "bold cyan"
show_always = true

# ãƒ›ã‚¹ãƒˆåè¡¨ç¤ºè¨­å®š
[hostname]
format = "($style)[$hostname]($style)"
style = "bold blue"
ssh_only = false
ssh_symbol = "ğŸ”„ "

# çµ‚äº†ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚¹è¡¨ç¤ºè¨­å®š
[status]
format = '[$symbol $status]($style) '
symbol = "âŒ"
success_symbol = "âœ…"
style = "red"
disabled = false

# ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰å®Ÿè¡Œæ™‚é–“è¡¨ç¤ºè¨­å®š
[cmd_duration]
format = "took [$duration]($style) "
style = "yellow"
# 1ç§’ä»¥ä¸Šã‹ã‹ã£ãŸã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ã®ã¿è¡¨ç¤º
min_time = 1000

# ç¾åœ¨æ™‚åˆ»è¡¨ç¤ºè¨­å®š
[time]
format = "at [$time]($style) "
style = "blue"
time_format = "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S"
disabled = false

# Node.jsç’°å¢ƒè¡¨ç¤ºè¨­å®š
[nodejs]
format = "$symbol[$version]($style) "
symbol = "ğŸ“¦ "
style = "green"

# ãƒ‘ãƒƒã‚±ãƒ¼ã‚¸æƒ…å ±è¡¨ç¤ºè¨­å®š
[package]
format = "[$symbol$name@$version]($style) "
symbol = "ğŸ“¦ "
style = "214"

# Gitãƒ–ãƒ©ãƒ³ãƒè¡¨ç¤ºè¨­å®š
[git_branch]
always_show_remote = true
format = '[$symbol$branch(...$remote_name/$remote_branch)]($style) '
style = "bold cyan"

[git_commit]
format = '[$symbol$commit]($style) '
only_detached = false
tag_disabled = false

[git_state]

# Gitã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚¹è¡¨ç¤ºè¨­å®š
[git_status]
format = '([(\[$ahead_behind\])]($style) $all_status)'
style = "bold cyan"
conflicted = "ğŸ³"
ahead = "â‡¡${count}"
behind = "â‡£${count}"
diverged = "â‡•â‡¡${ahead_count}â‡£${behind_count}"
up_to_date = "âœ¨"
untracked = "[?${count} untracked](red)"
stashed = "\\$"
modified = "[!${count} modified](yellow)"
staged = "[+${count} staged](bright-green)"
renamed = "[Â»${count} renamed](cyan)"
deleted = "[âœ˜${count} deleted](red)"

# ãƒ—ãƒ­ãƒ³ãƒ—ãƒˆæ–‡å­—è¨­å®š
[character]
success_symbol = "[>](bold green)"
error_symbol = "[>](bold red)"

[custom.envfile]
shell = ["zsh"]
detect_files = [".env"]
command = '''
if echo ":$OP_COMMAND_PATHS:" | grep -q ":$PWD:"; then
  echo "ğŸ”“"
else
  echo "ğŸ”’"
fi
'''
when = 'true'
format = '[$output]($style) '
style = 'bold yellow'

file.content:
#!/bin/sh
# Common tool integrations for all shells

# mise integration
if [ -f "$HOME/.local/bin/mise" ]; then
  # The actual activation will be done in shell-specific files
  export HAS_MISE=1
fi

# opam configuration
if type opam >/dev/null 2>&1; then
  # The actual evaluation will be done in shell-specific files
  export HAS_OPAM=1
fi

# Starship prompt integration
if type starship >/dev/null 2>&1; then
  export HAS_STARSHIP=1
fi

# gcloud configuration with mise python
if type mise >/dev/null 2>&1 && mise list | grep python >/dev/null && type gcloud >/dev/null 2>&1; then
  # shellcheck disable=SC2155
  export CLOUDSDK_PYTHON="$(mise which python)"
fi

file.content:
if [ "$ZSHRC_PROFILE" != "" ]; then
  zmodload zsh/zprof && zprof > /dev/null
fi

function zsh-profiler() {
  ZSHRC_PROFILE=1 zsh -i -c zprof
}

setopt IGNOREEOF

autoload -Uz colors
colors

autoload -Uz compinit
compinit

bindkey -e

bindkey "^[[3~" delete-char
bindkey "^?" backward-delete-char
bindkey ";5D" backward-word
bindkey ";5C" forward-word

autoload -Uz select-word-style
select-word-style default
zstyle ':zle:*' word-chars ' /=;@:{}[]()<>,|.'
zstyle ':zle:*' word-style unspecified

setopt share_history
setopt histignorealldups
setopt hist_ignore_space

HISTFILE=$ZDOTDIR/.zsh_history
HISTSIZE=2000
SAVEHIST=2000

# Load common settings
if [ -z "$SHELL_COMMON" ]; then
  SHELL_COMMON="$HOME/.shell_common"
fi
[ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/interactive.sh" ] && source "$SHELL_COMMON/interactive.sh"

if [ "$HAS_STARSHIP" = "1" ]; then
  eval "$(starship init zsh)"
fi

if type fzf &> /dev/null; then
  function fzf-history-selection() {
    local selected=""

    if [[ -n "$LBUFFER" ]]; then
      selected=`history 0 | fzf --query $LBUFFER | awk '{ $1=""; sub(/^[ \t]+/, ""); print }'`
    else
      selected=`history 0 | fzf | awk '{ $1=""; sub(/^[ \t]+/, ""); print }'`
    fi

    BUFFER=`[ ${#selected} -gt 0 ] && echo $selected || echo $BUFFER`
    CURSOR=$#BUFFER
    zle reset-prompt
  }

  zle -N fzf-history-selection
  bindkey '^R' fzf-history-selection
fi

# zsh-specific FZF tab completion
if type fzf &> /dev/null && [ -f ~/.zsh/functions/fzf-tab-completion.zsh ]; then
  source ~/.zsh/functions/fzf-tab-completion.zsh
  bindkey '^I' fzf_completion
fi

[ -f "$ZDOTDIR/ni.zsh" ] && source $ZDOTDIR/ni.zsh

echo -ne "\033]0;$(basename $PWD)\007"
function chpwd() {
  echo -ne "\033]0;$(basename $PWD)\007"
}

# Aikido Safe Chain: wrap package managers with malware scanning
[ -f "$HOME/.safe-chain/scripts/init-posix.sh" ] && source "$HOME/.safe-chain/scripts/init-posix.sh"

if [ -e $HOME/.zshrc.local ]; then
    source $HOME/.zshrc.local
fi

if [[ "$TERM_PROGRAM" == "vscode" ]]; then
  if [[ "$TERM_PROGRAM_VERSION" == *"-insider" ]]; then
    . "$(code-insiders --locate-shell-integration-path zsh)"
  else
    . "$(code --locate-shell-integration-path zsh)"
  fi
fi

file.content:
# Common shell initialization script for both zsh and bash

# Detect current shell
# shellcheck disable=SC2206
if [ -n "$ZSH_VERSION" ]; then
  CURRENT_SHELL="zsh"
elif [ -n "$BASH_VERSION" ]; then
  CURRENT_SHELL="bash"
else
  CURRENT_SHELL="sh"  # Fallback
fi

# Set common directory path
if [ -z "$SHELL_COMMON" ]; then
  # Default path for deployed files
  SHELL_COMMON="$HOME/.shell_common"
fi

# Load common environment variables
[ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/env.sh" ] && . "$SHELL_COMMON/env.sh"


# Load common path settings
if [ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/path.sh" ]; then
  . "$SHELL_COMMON/path.sh"

  # Apply paths based on shell type
  # Note: COMMON_PATHS array is bash/zsh specific, but this code only runs in those shells
  # shellcheck disable=SC3054
  if [ "$CURRENT_SHELL" = "zsh" ]; then
    # zsh-specific path handling
    # shellcheck disable=SC2154
    for p in "${COMMON_PATHS[@]}"; do
      # shellcheck disable=SC2128,SC2034,SC3030
      path=($p $path)
    done
  else
    # bash-specific path handling
    # shellcheck disable=SC2154
    for p in "${COMMON_PATHS[@]}"; do
      add_to_path "$p"
    done
    export PATH
  fi
fi

# Load common aliases
[ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/aliases.sh" ] && . "$SHELL_COMMON/aliases.sh"

# Load common functions
[ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/functions.sh" ] && . "$SHELL_COMMON/functions.sh"

# Load OS-specific common settings
case "$(uname -s)" in
  Darwin*)
    # macOS
    [ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/darwin.sh" ] && . "$SHELL_COMMON/darwin.sh"
    ;;
  Linux*)
    # Linux
    [ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/linux.sh" ] && . "$SHELL_COMMON/linux.sh"
    # WSL detection
    if grep -q microsoft /proc/version 2>/dev/null; then
      if [ -f "$HOME/.local/bin/wsl2-ssh-agent" ]; then
        eval "$($HOME/.local/bin/wsl2-ssh-agent -powershell-path pwsh.exe)"
      fi
      export BROWSER=wslview
    fi
    ;;
  MINGW*|MSYS*|CYGWIN*)
    # Windows
    [ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/windows.sh" ] && . "$SHELL_COMMON/windows.sh"
    ;;
esac

# Load common tool integrations
[ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/tools.sh" ] && . "$SHELL_COMMON/tools.sh"

# Shell-specific tool activations
# shellcheck disable=SC2154
if [ "$HAS_MISE" = "1" ] && [ -f "$HOME/.local/bin/mise" ]; then
  if [ "$CURRENT_SHELL" = "zsh" ]; then
    eval "$($HOME/.local/bin/mise activate zsh)"
  else
    eval "$($HOME/.local/bin/mise activate bash)"
  fi
fi

# Load Rust/Cargo environment
if [ -f "$HOME/.cargo/env" ]; then
  . "$HOME/.cargo/env"
fi

# shellcheck disable=SC2154
if [ "$HAS_OPAM" = "1" ] && type opam >/dev/null 2>&1; then
  eval "$(opam env)"
fi

file.content:
autoload -Uz add-zsh-hook

setopt prompt_subst

typeset -A emoji
emoji[ok]=$'\U2705'
emoji[error]=$'\U274C'
emoji[git]=$'\U1F500'
emoji[git_staged]=$'\U1F4DD'
emoji[git_changed]=$'\U1F4AC'
emoji[git_untracked]=$'\U2757'
emoji[git_clean]=$'\U2728'
emoji[node_package]=$'\U1F4E6'
emoji[right_arrow]=$'\U2794'

readonly local br=$'\n'
readonly local rawbr="
"

local vcs_git_indicator
function __vcs_git_indicator () {
  typeset -A git_info
  typeset -a git_indicator
  local git_status
  git_status=("${(f)$(git status --porcelain --branch 2> /dev/null)}")
  (( $? == 0 )) && {
    git_info[branch]="${${git_status[1]}#\#\# }"
    shift git_status
    git_info[all]=$#git_status
    git_info[tracked]=${#git_status:#\?\?*} # untrackã˜ã‚ƒãªã„ã‚‚ã®
    git_info[untracked]=$(( ${git_info[all]} - ${git_info[tracked]}))
    git_info[staged]=$(( ${#git_status:# ?*} - ${git_info[untracked]} )) # 1æ–‡å­—ç›®ãŒç©ºç™½ã˜ã‚ƒãªãã¦untrackã§ã¯ãªã„ã‚‚ã®ï¼ˆuntrackãŒ/^??/ã«ãƒãƒƒãƒã™ã‚‹å‰æ
    git_info[changed]=${#git_status:#? *} # 2æ–‡å­—ç›®ãŒç©ºç™½ã˜ã‚ƒãªã„ã‚‚ã®
    git_info[clean]=$(( ${git_info[all]} == 0 ))

    git_indicator+=("${emoji[git]} %{%F{blue}%B%}${git_info[branch]}%{%b%f%}")
    (( ${git_info[clean]}     )) && git_indicator+=("${emoji[git_clean]}")
    (( ${git_info[staged]}    )) && git_indicator+=("${emoji[git_staged]} %{%F{green}%}${git_info[staged]} staged%{%f%}")
    (( ${git_info[changed]}   )) && git_indicator+=("${emoji[git_changed]} %{%F{yellow}%}${git_info[changed]} unstaged%{%f%}")
    (( ${git_info[untracked]} )) && git_indicator+=("${emoji[git_untracked]} %{%F{red}%}${git_info[untracked]} untracked%{%f%}")
  }

  vcs_git_indicator="$git_indicator"
  if [ -n "$git_indicator" ]; then
    vcs_git_indicator+=$rawbr
  fi
}

add-zsh-hook precmd __vcs_git_indicator

local env_js_indicator env_js_indicator_cached env_js_lastpwd
function __env_js_indicator() {
  typeset -a js_indicator js_package_version
  local package_version package_name
  package_version=$(jq -r ".version" ./package.json 2> /dev/null)
  package_name=$(jq -r ".name" ./package.json 2> /dev/null)
  (( ${#package_version} != 0 )) && {
    js_package_version+=("${emoji[node_package]} %F{214}$package_name@v$package_version%f")

    if [ "$env_js_lastpwd" != "$PWD" ]; then
      local node_version

      if  [ -z "$node_version" ]; then
        node_version=$(node -v 2> /dev/null)
      fi

      if [ -n "$node_version" ]; then
        js_indicator+=("via %F{green}nodejs $node_version%f")
      fi

      local npm_version yarn_version pnpm_version
      if [ -z "$npm_version" -a -e package-lock.json ]; then
        npm_version=$(npm -v 2> /dev/null)
      fi

      if [ -n "$npm_version" ]; then
        js_indicator+=("with %F{green}npm v$npm_version%f")
      fi

      if [ -z "$yarn_version" -a -e yarn.lock ]; then
        yarn_version=$(yarn -v 2> /dev/null)
      fi

      if [ -n "$yarn_version" ]; then
        js_indicator+=("with %F{green}yarn v$yarn_version%f")
      fi

      if [ -z "$pnpm_version" -a -e pnpm-lock.yaml ]; then
        pnpm_version=$(pnpm -v 2> /dev/null)
      fi

      if [ -n "$pnpm_version" ]; then
        js_indicator+=("with %F{green}pnpm v$pnpm_version%f")
      fi

      env_js_indicator_cached="$js_indicator"
    fi
  }

  if (( ${#js_package_version} > 0 )); then
    env_js_indicator="$js_package_version $env_js_indicator_cached$rawbr"
  else
    env_js_indicator=""
  fi

  env_js_lastpwd=$PWD
}

add-zsh-hook precmd __env_js_indicator

function {
  local dir='%F{green}%B%~%{%b%f%}'
  local rc="%(?,${emoji[ok]} ,${emoji[error]} %F{red}%?%f)"
  local br=$'\n'

  local user
  if [ $UID -eq 0 ]; then
      user='%F{red}%B%n%b%f'
  else
      user='%F{cyan}%B%n%b%f'
  fi

  local host='%F{blue}%B%m%b%f'
  [ "$SSH_CLIENT" ] && local via="${${=SSH_CLIENT}[1]} %{%B%}${emoji[right_arrow]}%{%b%} "
  local git='$vcs_git_indicator'
  local js='$env_js_indicator'
  local mark=$'> '
  local datetime=$'%D{%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S %Z(%z)}'

  # æœ€åˆã¯è¡¨ç¤ºæ™‚ã®æ™‚åˆ»ãŒå‡ºã‚‹
  PROMPT="$dir $user($via$host)$rc %F{blue}$datetime%f $br$js$git$mark"
  # ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰å®Ÿè¡Œã™ã‚‹ã¨å®Ÿè¡Œæ™‚ã®æ™‚åˆ»ãŒæ®‹ã‚‹
  BASE_PROMPT="$dir $user($via$host)$rc %F{magenta}$datetime%f $br$js$git$mark"
}

function __rewrite_on_accept() {
  if [[ ${#PROMPT} -ne ${#BASE_PROMPT} ]]; then
    local saved=$PROMPT
    PROMPT=$BASE_PROMPT
    zle reset-prompt
    PROMPT=$saved
  fi
  zle accept-line
}
zle -N __rewrite_on_accept
bindkey '^M' __rewrite_on_accept

content.thinking:
Now I have a good understanding. Let me also check if there's a bashrc that uses starship.

Key findings:
1. `starship prompt` takes about 177ms â€” that's noticeable but not terrible. However, for every prompt render, this is significant.
2. The legacy `prompt.zsh` exists at `~/.zsh/prompt.zsh` but is NOT in source state
3. The legacy prompt uses `git status --porcelain --branch` directly â€” a standard approach
4. The starship config has these modules that need to be replicated:
   - shell indicator (bash/zsh)
   - directory
   - custom.envfile (1Password)
   - username
   - hostname
   - status (exit code)
   - time
   - cmd_duration
   - nodejs
   - package
   - git_branch, git_state, git_status
   - character (prompt mark)

Let me check for bashrc too.

1â†’#!/bin/sh
     2â†’# Common shell initialization script for both zsh and bash interactive sessions
     3â†’
     4â†’# Load common aliases
     5â†’# shellcheck disable=SC2154
     6â†’[ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/aliases.sh" ] && . "$SHELL_COMMON/aliases.sh"
     7â†’
     8â†’# FZF integration based on shell type
     9â†’if type fzf >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    10â†’  if [ "$CURRENT_SHELL" = "zsh" ]; then
    11â†’    # zsh-specific FZF integration (uses process substitution, zsh-only)
    12â†’    # shellcheck disable=SC3001
    13â†’    . <(fzf --zsh)
    14â†’  else
    15â†’    # bash-specific FZF integration
    16â†’    if [ -f ~/.fzf.bash ]; then

#!/bin/sh
# Common shell initialization script for both zsh and bash interactive sessions

# Load common aliases
# shellcheck disable=SC2154
[ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/aliases.sh" ] && . "$SHELL_COMMON/aliases.sh"

# FZF integration based on shell type
if type fzf >/dev/null 2>&1; then
  if [ "$CURRENT_SHELL" = "zsh" ]; then
    # zsh-specific FZF integration (uses process substitution, zsh-only)
    # shellcheck disable=SC3001
    . <(fzf --zsh)
  else
    # bash-specific FZF integration
    if [ -f ~/.fzf.bash ]; then
      . ~/.fzf.bash
    elif [ -f /usr/share/doc/fzf/examples/key-bindings.bash ]; then
      . /usr/share/doc/fzf/examples/key-bindings.bash
    fi
  fi
fi

# Update checkers (tools and dotfiles)
[ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/updates/chezmoi.sh" ] && . "$SHELL_COMMON/updates/chezmoi.sh"
[ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/updates/mise.sh" ] && . "$SHELL_COMMON/updates/mise.sh"
[ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/updates/dotfiles.sh" ] && . "$SHELL_COMMON/updates/dotfiles.sh"

file.content:
# .bashrc - Executed for interactive non-login shells

# Note: We don't exit early for non-interactive shells
# This allows testing and sourcing from scripts

# Set BASH_DIR to the location of bash configuration files
# BASH_DIR="$HOME/.bash"

# History settings
HISTCONTROL=ignoreboth:erasedups  # Equivalent to zsh's histignorealldups
HISTSIZE=2000
HISTFILESIZE=2000
shopt -s histappend              # Append to history file

# Check the window size after each command
shopt -s checkwinsize

# Make less more friendly for non-text input files
[ -x /usr/bin/lesspipe ] && eval "$(SHELL=/bin/sh lesspipe)"


# Load common settings
if [ -z "$SHELL_COMMON" ]; then
  SHELL_COMMON="$HOME/.shell_common"
fi
[ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/interactive.sh" ] && source "$SHELL_COMMON/interactive.sh"

# Terminal title (if not already set by common init)
if [[ "$PROMPT_COMMAND" != *"echo -ne"* ]]; then
  PROMPT_COMMAND='echo -ne "\033]0;$(basename "$PWD")\007"'
fi

# Load bash-specific prompt (fallback if Starship is not available)
if [ "$HAS_STARSHIP" = "1" ]; then
  eval "$(starship init bash)"
fi

# Source local configuration if it exists
if [ -f "$HOME/.bashrc.local" ]; then
    . "$HOME/.bashrc.local"
fi

# VSCode shell integration
if [ "$TERM_PROGRAM" = "vscode" ]; then
  if [[ "$TERM_PROGRAM_VERSION" == *-insider ]]; then
    . "$(code-insiders --locate-shell-integration-path bash)"
  else
    . "$(code --locate-shell-integration-path bash)"
  fi
fi

# enable programmable completion features (you don't need to enable
# this, if it's already enabled in /etc/bash.bashrc and /etc/profile
# sources /etc/bash.bashrc).
if ! shopt -oq posix; then
  if [ -f /usr/share/bash-completion/bash_completion ]; then
    . /usr/share/bash-completion/bash_completion
  elif [ -f /etc/bash_completion ]; then
    . /etc/bash_completion
  fi
fi

content.thinking:
Good, now I have all the information I need. Let me create the research.md and plan.md.

Key findings:
1. `starship prompt` takes about 177ms per invocation - noticeable
2. Both bash and zsh use starship via `eval "$(starship init $shell)"`
3. The starship config has many modules, but user wants only the essential ones
4. There's a legacy `prompt.zsh` at `~/.zsh/prompt.zsh` (not in source state) that already implements a similar prompt in pure zsh
5. bash/zsh ä¸¡å¯¾å¿œãŒå¿…è¦


6. The essential elements are directory, git info, exit status, and prompt character, with username@hostname useful for SSH and the 1Password integration probably important too. I'll skip the less critical items like version indicators and commit hashes. For the architecture, I'm thinking a pure-shell approach using zsh's `precmd` hooks for speed.

For bash, I'd rely on `PROMPT_COMMAND` and `PS1` escapes, while git info comes from a single `git status` call to keep things fast. Both shells can track command duration through their respective hook systems. Rather than a single POSIX script or a compiled binary, separate shell-specific scripts with shared helpers seems like the right balance between performance and maintainability.

Looking at the existing directory structure, I'd organize this as shared functions in `dot_shell_common/`, then zsh-specific and bash-specific prompt files that source those helpers. Since bash doesn't have a dedicated `dot_bash/` directory like zsh does, the bash prompt logic would integrate directly into `.bashrc`. For chezmoi, these would live in the appropriate subdirectories under `home/`.

As for what's actually essential in the promptâ€”the user mentioned starship handles most of it, but I should clarify what they really need: directory, git info, exit status, and prompt character are probably non-negotiable, while things like timestamps or language version indicators might be nice-to-have rather than necessary. I'll let them decide what matters most.

Now I'm going to write out the research and plan documents, starting by setting up the session directory.

content.content:
1â†’#!/bin/sh
     2â†’# Common tool integrations for all shells
     3â†’
     4â†’# mise integration
     5â†’if [ -f "$HOME/.local/bin/mise" ]; then
     6â†’  # The actual activation will be done in shell-specific files
     7â†’  export HAS_MISE=1
     8â†’fi
     9â†’
    10â†’# opam configuration
    11â†’if type opam >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    12â†’  # The actual evaluation will be done in shell-specific files
    13â†’  export HAS_OPAM=1
    14â†’fi
    15â†’
    16â†’# Starship prompt integration
    17â†’if type starship >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    18â†’  export HAS_STARSHIP=1
    19â†’fi
    20â†’
    21â†’# gcloud configuration with mise python
    22â†’if type mise >/dev/null 2>&1 && mise list | grep python >/dev/null && type gcloud >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    23â†’  # shellcheck disable=SC2155
    24â†’  export CLOUDSDK_PYTHON="$(mise which python)"
    25â†’fi
    26â†’
    27â†’

1â†’if [ "$ZSHRC_PROFILE" != "" ]; then
     2â†’  zmodload zsh/zprof && zprof > /dev/null

     4â†’
     5â†’function zsh-profiler() {

     9â†’setopt IGNOREEOF

    11â†’autoload -Uz colors
    12â†’colors

    17â†’bindkey -e

    19â†’bindkey "^[[3~" delete-char

    21â†’bindkey ";5D" backward-word
    22â†’bindkey ";5C" forward-word
    23â†’
    24â†’autoload -Uz select-word-style
    25â†’select-word-style default
    26â†’zstyle ':zle:*' word-chars ' /=;@:{}[]()<>,|.'
    27â†’zstyle ':zle:*' word-style unspecified
    28â†’
    29â†’setopt share_history
    30â†’setopt histignorealldups

    33â†’HISTFILE=$ZDOTDIR/.zsh_history
    34â†’HISTSIZE=2000
    35â†’SAVEHIST=2000

    37â†’# Load common settings
    38â†’if [ -z "$SHELL_COMMON" ]; then
    39â†’  SHELL_COMMON="$HOME/.shell_common"
    40â†’fi
    41â†’[ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/interactive.sh" ] && source "$SHELL_COMMON/interactive.sh"
    42â†’
    43â†’if [ "$HAS_STARSHIP" = "1" ]; then
    44â†’  eval "$(starship init zsh)"
    45â†’fi
    46â†’
    47â†’if type fzf &> /dev/null; then
    48â†’  function fzf-history-selection() {
    49â†’    local selected=""
    50â†’
    51â†’    if [[ -n "$LBUFFER" ]]; then
    52â†’      selected=`history 0 | fzf --query $LBUFFER | awk '{ $1=""; sub(/^[ \t]+/, ""); print }'`
    53â†’    else
    54â†’      selected=`history 0 | fzf | awk '{ $1=""; sub(/^[ \t]+/, ""); print }'`
    55â†’    fi
    56â†’
    57â†’    BUFFER=`[ ${#selected} -gt 0 ] && echo $selected || echo $BUFFER`
    58â†’    CURSOR=$#BUFFER
    59â†’    zle reset-prompt
    60â†’  }
    61â†’
    62â†’  zle -N fzf-history-selection
    63â†’  bindkey '^R' fzf-history-selection
    64â†’fi
    65â†’
    66â†’# zsh-specific FZF tab completion
    67â†’if type fzf &> /dev/null && [ -f ~/.zsh/functions/fzf-tab-completion.zsh ]; then
    68â†’  source ~/.zsh/functions/fzf-tab-completion.zsh
    69â†’  bindkey '^I' fzf_completion
    70â†’fi
    71â†’
    72â†’[ -f "$ZDOTDIR/ni.zsh" ] && source $ZDOTDIR/ni.zsh
    73â†’
    74â†’echo -ne "\033]0;$(basename $PWD)\007"
    75â†’function chpwd() {
    76â†’  echo -ne "\033]0;$(basename $PWD)\007"
    77â†’}
    78â†’
    79â†’# Aikido Safe Chain: wrap package managers with malware scanning
    80â†’[ -f "$HOME/.safe-chain/scripts/init-posix.sh" ] && source "$HOME/.safe-chain/scripts/init-posix.sh"
    81â†’
    82â†’if [ -e $HOME/.zshrc.local ]; then
    83â†’    source $HOME/.zshrc.local
    84â†’fi
    85â†’
    86â†’if [[ "$TERM_PROGRAM" == "vscode" ]]; then
    87â†’  if [[ "$TERM_PROGRAM_VERSION" == *"-insider" ]]; then
    88â†’    . "$(code-insiders --locate-shell-integration-path zsh)"
    89â†’  else
    90â†’    . "$(code --locate-shell-integration-path zsh)"
    91â†’  fi
    92â†’fi
    93â†’
    94â†’:

1â†’#!/bin/sh
     2â†’# Common shell initialization script for both zsh and bash interactive sessions
     3â†’
     4â†’# Load common aliases
     5â†’# shellcheck disable=SC2154
     6â†’[ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/aliases.sh" ] && . "$SHELL_COMMON/aliases.sh"
     7â†’
     8â†’# FZF integration based on shell type
     9â†’if type fzf >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    10â†’  if [ "$CURRENT_SHELL" = "zsh" ]; then
    11â†’    # zsh-specific FZF integration (uses process substitution, zsh-only)
    12â†’    # shellcheck disable=SC3001
    13â†’    . <(fzf --zsh)
    14â†’  else
    15â†’    # bash-specific FZF integration
    16â†’    if [ -f ~/.fzf.bash ]; then
    17â†’      . ~/.fzf.bash
    18â†’    elif [ -f /usr/share/doc/fzf/examples/key-bindings.bash ]; then
    19â†’      . /usr/share/doc/fzf/examples/key-bindings.bash
    20â†’    fi
    21â†’  fi
    22â†’fi
    23â†’
    24â†’# Update checkers (tools and dotfiles)
    25â†’[ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/updates/chezmoi.sh" ] && . "$SHELL_COMMON/updates/chezmoi.sh"
    26â†’[ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/updates/mise.sh" ] && . "$SHELL_COMMON/updates/mise.sh"
    27â†’[ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/updates/dotfiles.sh" ] && . "$SHELL_COMMON/updates/dotfiles.sh"
    28â†’

1â†’# .bashrc - Executed for interactive non-login shells
     2â†’
     3â†’# Note: We don't exit early for non-interactive shells
     4â†’# This allows testing and sourcing from scripts
     5â†’
     6â†’# Set BASH_DIR to the location of bash configuration files
     7â†’# BASH_DIR="$HOME/.bash"
     8â†’
     9â†’# History settings
    10â†’HISTCONTROL=ignoreboth:erasedups  # Equivalent to zsh's histignorealldups
    11â†’HISTSIZE=2000
    12â†’HISTFILESIZE=2000
    13â†’shopt -s histappend              # Append to history file
    14â†’
    15â†’# Check the window size after each command
    16â†’shopt -s checkwinsize
    17â†’
    18â†’# Make less more friendly for non-text input files
    19â†’[ -x /usr/bin/lesspipe ] && eval "$(SHELL=/bin/sh lesspipe)"
    20â†’
    21â†’
    22â†’# Load common settings
    23â†’if [ -z "$SHELL_COMMON" ]; then
    24â†’  SHELL_COMMON="$HOME/.shell_common"
    25â†’fi
    26â†’[ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/interactive.sh" ] && source "$SHELL_COMMON/interactive.sh"
    27â†’
    28â†’# Terminal title (if not already set by common init)
    29â†’if [[ "$PROMPT_COMMAND" != *"echo -ne"* ]]; then
    30â†’  PROMPT_COMMAND='echo -ne "\033]0;$(basename "$PWD")\007"'
    31â†’fi
    32â†’
    33â†’# Load bash-specific prompt (fallback if Starship is not available)
    34â†’if [ "$HAS_STARSHIP" = "1" ]; then
    35â†’  eval "$(starship init bash)"
    36â†’fi
    37â†’
    38â†’# Source local configuration if it exists
    39â†’if [ -f "$HOME/.bashrc.local" ]; then
    40â†’    . "$HOME/.bashrc.local"
    41â†’fi

1â†’#!/bin/sh
     2â†’# Common tool integrations for all shells
     3â†’
     4â†’# mise integration
     5â†’if [ -f "$HOME/.local/bin/mise" ]; then
     6â†’  # The actual activation will be done in shell-specific files
     7â†’  export HAS_MISE=1
     8â†’fi
     9â†’
    10â†’# opam configuration
    11â†’if type opam >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    12â†’  # The actual evaluation will be done in shell-specific files
    13â†’  export HAS_OPAM=1
    14â†’fi
    15â†’
    16â†’# Starship prompt integration
    17â†’if type starship >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    18â†’  export HAS_STARSHIP=1
    19â†’fi
    20â†’
    21â†’# gcloud configuration with mise python
    22â†’if type mise >/dev/null 2>&1 && mise list | grep python >/dev/null && type gcloud >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    23â†’  # shellcheck disable=SC2155
    24â†’  export CLOUDSDK_PYTHON="$(mise which python)"
    25â†’fi
    26â†’
    27â†’

1â†’# .bashrc - Executed for interactive non-login shells
     2â†’
     3â†’# Note: We don't exit early for non-interactive shells
     4â†’# This allows testing and sourcing from scripts
     5â†’
     6â†’# Set BASH_DIR to the location of bash configuration files
     7â†’# BASH_DIR="$HOME/.bash"
     8â†’
     9â†’# History settings
    10â†’HISTCONTROL=ignoreboth:erasedups  # Equivalent to zsh's histignorealldups
    11â†’HISTSIZE=2000
    12â†’HISTFILESIZE=2000
    13â†’shopt -s histappend              # Append to history file
    14â†’
    15â†’# Check the window size after each command
    16â†’shopt -s checkwinsize
    17â†’
    18â†’# Make less more friendly for non-text input files
    19â†’[ -x /usr/bin/lesspipe ] && eval "$(SHELL=/bin/sh lesspipe)"
    20â†’
    21â†’
    22â†’# Load common settings
    23â†’if [ -z "$SHELL_COMMON" ]; then
    24â†’  SHELL_COMMON="$HOME/.shell_common"
    25â†’fi
    26â†’[ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/interactive.sh" ] && source "$SHELL_COMMON/interactive.sh"
    27â†’
    28â†’# Terminal title (if not already set by common init)
    29â†’if [[ "$PROMPT_COMMAND" != *"echo -ne"* ]]; then
    30â†’  PROMPT_COMMAND='echo -ne "\033]0;$(basename "$PWD")\007"'
    31â†’fi
    32â†’
    33â†’# Load bash-specific prompt (fallback if Starship is not available)
    34â†’if [ "$HAS_STARSHIP" = "1" ]; then
    35â†’  eval "$(starship init bash)"
    36â†’fi
    37â†’
    38â†’# Source local configuration if it exists
    39â†’if [ -f "$HOME/.bashrc.local" ]; then
    40â†’    . "$HOME/.bashrc.local"
    41â†’fi
    42â†’
    43â†’# VSCode shell integration
    44â†’if [ "$TERM_PROGRAM" = "vscode" ]; then
    45â†’  if [[ "$TERM_PROGRAM_VERSION" == *-insider ]]; then
    46â†’    . "$(code-insiders --locate-shell-integration-path bash)"
    47â†’  else
    48â†’    . "$(code --locate-shell-integration-path bash)"
    49â†’  fi
    50â†’fi
    51â†’
    52â†’# enable programmable completion features (you don't need to enable
    53â†’# this, if it's already enabled in /etc/bash.bashrc and /etc/profile
    54â†’# sources /etc/bash.bashrc).
    55â†’if ! shopt -oq posix; then
    56â†’  if [ -f /usr/share/bash-completion/bash_completion ]; then
    57â†’    . /usr/share/bash-completion/bash_completion
    58â†’  elif [ -f /etc/bash_completion ]; then
    59â†’    . /etc/bash_completion
    60â†’  fi
    61â†’fi
    62â†’

1â†’if [ "$ZSHRC_PROFILE" != "" ]; then
     2â†’  zmodload zsh/zprof && zprof > /dev/null
     3â†’fi
     4â†’
     5â†’function zsh-profiler() {
     6â†’  ZSHRC_PROFILE=1 zsh -i -c zprof
     7â†’}
     8â†’
     9â†’setopt IGNOREEOF
    10â†’
    11â†’autoload -Uz colors
    12â†’colors
    13â†’
    14â†’autoload -Uz compinit
    15â†’compinit
    16â†’
    17â†’bindkey -e
    18â†’
    19â†’bindkey "^[[3~" delete-char
    20â†’bindkey "^?" backward-delete-char
    21â†’bindkey ";5D" backward-word
    22â†’bindkey ";5C" forward-word
    23â†’
    24â†’autoload -Uz select-word-style
    25â†’select-word-style default
    26â†’zstyle ':zle:*' word-chars ' /=;@:{}[]()<>,|.'
    27â†’zstyle ':zle:*' word-style unspecified
    28â†’
    29â†’setopt share_history
    30â†’setopt histignorealldups
    31â†’setopt hist_ignore_space
    32â†’
    33â†’HISTFILE=$ZDOTDIR/.zsh_history
    34â†’HISTSIZE=2000
    35â†’SAVEHIST=2000
    36â†’
    37â†’# Load common settings
    38â†’if [ -z "$SHELL_COMMON" ]; then
    39â†’  SHELL_COMMON="$HOME/.shell_common"
    40â†’fi
    41â†’[ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/interactive.sh" ] && source "$SHELL_COMMON/interactive.sh"
    42â†’
    43â†’if [ "$HAS_STARSHIP" = "1" ]; then
    44â†’  eval "$(starship init zsh)"
    45â†’fi
    46â†’
    47â†’if type fzf &> /dev/null; then
    48â†’  function fzf-history-selection() {
    49â†’    local selected=""
    50â†’
    51â†’    if [[ -n "$LBUFFER" ]]; then
    52â†’      selected=`history 0 | fzf --query $LBUFFER | awk '{ $1=""; sub(/^[ \t]+/, ""); print }'`
    53â†’    else
    54â†’      selected=`history 0 | fzf | awk '{ $1=""; sub(/^[ \t]+/, ""); print }'`
    55â†’    fi
    56â†’
    57â†’    BUFFER=`[ ${#selected} -gt 0 ] && echo $selected || echo $BUFFER`
    58â†’    CURSOR=$#BUFFER
    59â†’    zle reset-prompt
    60â†’  }
    61â†’
    62â†’  zle -N fzf-history-selection
    63â†’  bindkey '^R' fzf-history-selection
    64â†’fi
    65â†’
    66â†’# zsh-specific FZF tab completion
    67â†’if type fzf &> /dev/null && [ -f ~/.zsh/functions/fzf-tab-completion.zsh ]; then
    68â†’  source ~/.zsh/functions/fzf-tab-completion.zsh
    69â†’  bindkey '^I' fzf_completion
    70â†’fi
    71â†’
    72â†’[ -f "$ZDOTDIR/ni.zsh" ] && source $ZDOTDIR/ni.zsh
    73â†’
    74â†’echo -ne "\033]0;$(basename $PWD)\007"
    75â†’function chpwd() {
    76â†’  echo -ne "\033]0;$(basename $PWD)\007"
    77â†’}
    78â†’
    79â†’# Aikido Safe Chain: wrap package managers with malware scanning
    80â†’[ -f "$HOME/.safe-chain/scripts/init-posix.sh" ] && source "$HOME/.safe-chain/scripts/init-posix.sh"
    81â†’
    82â†’if [ -e $HOME/.zshrc.local ]; then
    83â†’    source $HOME/.zshrc.local
    84â†’fi
    85â†’
    86â†’if [[ "$TERM_PROGRAM" == "vscode" ]]; then
    87â†’  if [[ "$TERM_PROGRAM_VERSION" == *"-insider" ]]; then
    88â†’    . "$(code-insiders --locate-shell-integration-path zsh)"
    89â†’  else
    90â†’    . "$(code --locate-shell-integration-path zsh)"
    91â†’  fi
    92â†’fi
    93â†’
    94â†’:
    95â†’

content.content:
1â†’# .bashrc - Executed for interactive non-login shells
     2â†’
     3â†’# Note: We don't exit early for non-interactive shells
     4â†’# This allows testing and sourcing from scripts
     5â†’
     6â†’# Set BASH_DIR to the location of bash configuration files
     7â†’# BASH_DIR="$HOME/.bash"
     8â†’
     9â†’# History settings
    10â†’HISTCONTROL=ignoreboth:erasedups  # Equivalent to zsh's histignorealldups
    11â†’HISTSIZE=2000
    12â†’HISTFILESIZE=2000
    13â†’shopt -s histappend              # Append to history file
    14â†’
    15â†’# Check the window size after each command
    16â†’shopt -s checkwinsize
    17â†’
    18â†’# Make less more friendly for non-text input files
    19â†’[ -x /usr/bin/lesspipe ] && eval "$(SHELL=/bin/sh lesspipe)"
    20â†’
    21â†’
    22â†’# Load common settings
    23â†’if [ -z "$SHELL_COMMON" ]; then
    24â†’  SHELL_COMMON="$HOME/.shell_common"
    25â†’fi
    26â†’[ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/interactive.sh" ] && source "$SHELL_COMMON/interactive.sh"
    27â†’
    28â†’# Terminal title (if not already set by common init)
    29â†’if [[ "$PROMPT_COMMAND" != *"echo -ne"* ]]; then
    30â†’  PROMPT_COMMAND='echo -ne "\033]0;$(basename "$PWD")\007"'
    31â†’fi
    32â†’
    33â†’# Load bash-specific prompt (fallback if Starship is not available)
    34â†’if [ "$HAS_STARSHIP" = "1" ]; then
    35â†’  eval "$(starship init bash)"
    36â†’fi
    37â†’
    38â†’# Source local configuration if it exists
    39â†’if [ -f "$HOME/.bashrc.local" ]; then
    40â†’    . "$HOME/.bashrc.local"
    41â†’fi
    42â†’
    43â†’# VSCode shell integration
    44â†’if [ "$TERM_PROGRAM" = "vscode" ]; then
    45â†’  if [[ "$TERM_PROGRAM_VERSION" == *-insider ]]; then
    46â†’    . "$(code-insiders --locate-shell-integration-path bash)"
    47â†’  else
    48â†’    . "$(code --locate-shell-integration-path bash)"
    49â†’  fi
    50â†’fi
    51â†’
    52â†’# enable programmable completion features (you don't need to enable
    53â†’# this, if it's already enabled in /etc/bash.bashrc and /etc/profile
    54â†’# sources /etc/bash.bashrc).
    55â†’if ! shopt -oq posix; then
    56â†’  if [ -f /usr/share/bash-completion/bash_completion ]; then
    57â†’    . /usr/share/bash-completion/bash_completion
    58â†’  elif [ -f /etc/bash_completion ]; then
    59â†’    . /etc/bash_completion
    60â†’  fi
    61â†’fi
    62â†’

1â†’if [ "$ZSHRC_PROFILE" != "" ]; then
     2â†’  zmodload zsh/zprof && zprof > /dev/null
     3â†’fi
     4â†’
     5â†’function zsh-profiler() {
     6â†’  ZSHRC_PROFILE=1 zsh -i -c zprof
     7â†’}
     8â†’
     9â†’setopt IGNOREEOF
    10â†’
    11â†’autoload -Uz colors
    12â†’colors
    13â†’
    14â†’autoload -Uz compinit
    15â†’compinit
    16â†’
    17â†’bindkey -e
    18â†’
    19â†’bindkey "^[[3~" delete-char
    20â†’bindkey "^?" backward-delete-char
    21â†’bindkey ";5D" backward-word
    22â†’bindkey ";5C" forward-word
    23â†’
    24â†’autoload -Uz select-word-style
    25â†’select-word-style default
    26â†’zstyle ':zle:*' word-chars ' /=;@:{}[]()<>,|.'
    27â†’zstyle ':zle:*' word-style unspecified
    28â†’
    29â†’setopt share_history
    30â†’setopt histignorealldups
    31â†’setopt hist_ignore_space
    32â†’
    33â†’HISTFILE=$ZDOTDIR/.zsh_history
    34â†’HISTSIZE=2000
    35â†’SAVEHIST=2000
    36â†’
    37â†’# Load common settings
    38â†’if [ -z "$SHELL_COMMON" ]; then
    39â†’  SHELL_COMMON="$HOME/.shell_common"
    40â†’fi
    41â†’[ -f "$SHELL_COMMON/interactive.sh" ] && source "$SHELL_COMMON/interactive.sh"
    42â†’
    43â†’if [ "$HAS_STARSHIP" = "1" ]; then
    44â†’  eval "$(starship init zsh)"
    45â†’fi
    46â†’
    47â†’if type fzf &> /dev/null; then
    48â†’  function fzf-history-selection() {
    49â†’    local selected=""
    50â†’
    51â†’    if [[ -n "$LBUFFER" ]]; then
    52â†’      selected=`history 0 | fzf --query $LBUFFER | awk '{ $1=""; sub(/^[ \t]+/, ""); print }'`
    53â†’    else
    54â†’      selected=`history 0 | fzf | awk '{ $1=""; sub(/^[ \t]+/, ""); print }'`
    55â†’    fi
    56â†’
    57â†’    BUFFER=`[ ${#selected} -gt 0 ] && echo $selected || echo $BUFFER`
    58â†’    CURSOR=$#BUFFER
    59â†’    zle reset-prompt
    60â†’  }
    61â†’
    62â†’  zle -N fzf-history-selection

#!/bin/sh
# Git information extraction for shell prompts
# POSIX sh compatible - shared between zsh and bash

__prompt_git_info() {
  # Reset all variables
  PROMPT_GIT_BRANCH=""
  PROMPT_GIT_AHEAD=""
  PROMPT_GIT_BEHIND=""
  PROMPT_GIT_STAGED=0
  PROMPT_GIT_MODIFIED=0
  PROMPT_GIT_UNTRACKED=0
  PROMPT_GIT_DELETED=0
  PROMPT_GIT_STATE=""
  PROMPT_GIT_ACTIVE=0

  # Check if we're in a git repository
  local git_dir
  git_dir="$(git rev-parse --git-dir 2>/dev/null)" || return

  PROMPT_GIT_ACTIVE=1

  # Detect special states (merge, rebase, etc.)
  if [ -f "$git_dir/MERGE_HEAD" ]; then
    PROMPT_GIT_STATE="merge"
  elif [ -d "$git_dir/rebase-merge" ]; then
    PROMPT_GIT_STATE="rebase"
  elif [ -d "$git_dir/rebase-apply" ]; then
    PROMPT_GIT_STATE="rebase"
  elif [ -f "$git_dir/CHERRY_PICK_HEAD" ]; then
    PROMPT_GIT_STATE="cherry-pick"
  elif [ -f "$git_dir/BISECT_LOG" ]; then
    PROMPT_GIT_STATE="bisect"
  elif [ -f "$git_dir/REVERT_HEAD" ]; then
    PROMPT_GIT_STATE="revert"
  fi

  # Get branch and status in one command
  local line
  git status --porcelain --branch 2>/dev/null | while IFS= read -r line; do
    case "$line" in
      '## '*)
        # Parse branch header: ## branch...remote [ahead N, behind N]
        local header="${line#\#\# }"
        # Extract branch name (before ...)
        case "$header" in
          *...*)
            PROMPT_GIT_BRANCH="${header%%...*}"
            local tracking="${header#*...}"
            # Extract ahead/behind counts
            case "$tracking" in
              *'[ahead '*)
                local tmp="${tracking#*\[ahead }"
                PROMPT_GIT_AHEAD="${tmp%%[],]*}"
                ;;
            esac
            case "$tracking" in
              *'behind '*)
                local tmp="${tracking#*behind }"
                PROMPT_GIT_BEHIND="${tmp%%[],]*}"
                ;;
            esac
            ;;
          'No commits yet on '*)
            PROMPT_GIT_BRANCH="${header#No commits yet on }"
            ;;
          *)
            PROMPT_GIT_BRANCH="$header"
            ;;
        esac
        ;;
      '??'*)
        PROMPT_GIT_UNTRACKED=$((PROMPT_GIT_UNTRACKED + 1))
        ;;
      *)
        # Parse two-character status code
        local index_status="${line%"${line#?}"}"
        local work_status="${line#?}"
        work_status="${work_status%"${work_status#?}"}"

        case "$index_status" in
          [MADRC]) PROMPT_GIT_STAGED=$((PROMPT_GIT_STAGED + 1)) ;;
        esac
        case "$work_status" in
          M) PROMPT_GIT_MODIFIED=$((PROMPT_GIT_MODIFIED + 1)) ;;
          D) PROMPT_GIT_DELETED=$((PROMPT_GIT_DELETED + 1)) ;;
        esac
        ;;
    esac
  done
}

#!/bin/sh
# Command duration measurement helper for shell prompts
# POSIX sh compatible - shared between zsh and bash
#
# Usage:
#   zsh:  add-zsh-hook preexec __prompt_cmd_timer_start
#         add-zsh-hook precmd __prompt_cmd_timer_stop
#   bash: trap '__prompt_cmd_timer_start' DEBUG (if no existing DEBUG trap)
#         call __prompt_cmd_timer_stop in PROMPT_COMMAND

__prompt_cmd_timer_start() {
  PROMPT_CMD_TIMER_START="${PROMPT_CMD_TIMER_START:-$SECONDS}"
}

__prompt_cmd_timer_stop() {
  PROMPT_CMD_DURATION=""
  if [ -n "$PROMPT_CMD_TIMER_START" ]; then
    local elapsed=$((SECONDS - PROMPT_CMD_TIMER_START))
    if [ "$elapsed" -ge 1 ]; then
      if [ "$elapsed" -ge 60 ]; then
        local minutes=$((elapsed / 60))
        local secs=$((elapsed % 60))
        PROMPT_CMD_DURATION="${minutes}m${secs}s"
      else
        PROMPT_CMD_DURATION="${elapsed}s"
      fi
    fi
    unset PROMPT_CMD_TIMER_START
  fi
}
